intro: Beccariella queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland beccariella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, preferring moist and nutrient-rich soils. Beccariella queenslandica is often found in the northern regions of Queensland, where it thrives in the tropical climate.
